summary:
C# is a popular computer programming language created by Microsoft. It was first released in 2000 and is now an international standard. C# is versatile, supporting various programming styles like imperative, object-oriented, and functional programming. The language is statically and strongly typed, making it efficient and reliable.

Initially, C# was closed-source, but Microsoft later released open-source tools like Visual Studio Code and the .NET platform, making C# more accessible. The latest version, C# 12.0, was launched in 2023.
title: C Sharp (programming language)
